ygData.subject: And in the local paper ...
ygData.msgSnippet: The third paragraph from an article in the Saturday, August 7 The News & Observer (Raleigh, NC). - must give legal credit on quotes: For the first time
ygData.messageBody:
The third paragraph from an article in the Saturday, August 7 "The News &
Observer" (Raleigh, NC). - must give legal credit on quotes:

"For the first time ever, ornithologists, government regulators and
communications-industry officials will convene at a special workshop in
Ithica, N.Y. on Aug. 11 to fugure out how bad the whacking problem is and
how it may be stopped."

???
Eh? Well, no its not about EQ, or even about GBLT, or even about
government regulators trying to stifle another form of sexual expression.
;P Here's the second paragraph, for those who wondered what in the <bleep>
the ornithologists were doing there.

"Biologists fear that each year millions of U.S. migratory birds become
disoriented by lights on communications towers and crash - into the towers,
the ground or even each other -- and die. The experts call it getting
whacked".

- Lora
